message_1: The task is to find the minimum positive integer x, such that $3^x \equiv 12 \pmod{17}$.
message_2:
To find the minimum positive integer x, we can start by calculating the powers of 3 modulo 17 until we find the one that is congruent to 12.

$3^1 \equiv 3 \pmod{17}$

$3^2 \equiv 9 \pmod{17}$

$3^3 \equiv 27 \equiv 10 \pmod{17}$

$3^4 \equiv 81 \equiv 13 \pmod{17}$

$3^5 \equiv 243 \equiv 6 \pmod{17}$

$3^6 \equiv 729 \equiv 18 \equiv 1 \pmod{17}$

$3^7 \equiv 2187 \equiv 51 \equiv 12 \pmod{17}$

So, the minimum positive integer x is 7, as $3^7 \equiv 12 \pmod{17}$.
